column5: Hey Guys  The boat has not been used for some time now--prob 3 weeks to month  I opened the storage compartment lid--and there was a real bad sulpher smell lingering in there.  Both batteries are charged right up  Wonderin if I should be more concerned with them during hook ups now---never smelled that before?  Do Think they're on their way Out??
Any sign of a leak in there?
They might have gotten a power surge or been over charged somehow.....
Hey Roy  Don't see any leaks---I'll check that tomorrow again--but nothing evident
Also I did charge one battery up after the last trip--never used it after being charged

Sulphur smell is the common sign that a battery has been "boiled" or over charged.  I would think whatever you are using for a charger may be the culprit or one of the batteries has an internal short causing a problem.  Take them out of the boat compartment and test each individually.  Remember battery safety, wear goggles when dealing with suspect batteries.
Thanks Fisherman  I'm using the onboard Minn Kota charger
Before you do any more charging you might want to pop the tops and check the levels. If there a bit low top em up with distilled water and recharge. Good luck.

Also wash them with a water and baking soda solution, rinse well and then make sure they are dry.  High humidity and/or moisture on the batteries can cause a current flow from one battery post to the other and slowly discharge your batteries.
Be VERY CAREFUL when working with batteries. I had 1 EXPLODE in my face when I was boosting a car. They do explode just like a bomb.
Lots of good solid advice here.
Thanks again guys---will look into these
